answers.text:
Hello Jonn- Thanks for your interest in Priority Based Budgeting. ICMA has several resources for a PBB primer. See this link for a comprehensive overview of the success Walnut Creek, CA experienced w/ PBB  "A Community Connected" The 2012-2014 Budget Story using Priority Based Budgeting http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/305402/A_Community_Connected_The_201214_Budget_Story_Using_PBB and this link to powerpoint slides from our presentation at the ICMA Boston Conference http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/groups/kn/group_files/1302/center_for_management_strategies_group#FileFolder=2013%2520ICMA%2520Annual%2520Conference%2520-%2520Presentation%2520Slides. If you have any further questions feel free to contact me at efabian@pbbcenter.org. Thanks!

answers.text:
Hi Jonn, 
Thank you for asking such a great question! We have many many materials on the Knowledge Network on Priority Based Budgeting so the materials posted below are just a starting point. I would recommend you also look at this introduction to PBB and to check out the ICMA Center for Management Strategies because they frequently post documents related to PBB and one of their main bloggers, Chris Fabian, is the Co Founder of the Center for PBB.
•   “Anatomy of a Priority Based Budgeting Process” explains how the process is works and should be a good introduction for people learning about PBB for the first time. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/305409
•   “Priority Based Budgeting: Seeing Things Differently” is an article posted this summer on the Knowledge Network that gives a good summary of how PBB differs from traditional budgeting http://icma.org/en/international/resources/insights/Article/103432/PriorityBased_Budgeting_Seeing_Things_Differently
•   “The Budget as a “story”- Walnut Creek’s Breakthrough (it’s Awesome!)” is a case study of the City of Walnut Creek and how they were able to successfully use PBB. http://icma.org/en/results/management_strategies/resources/blogpost/796/The_Budget_as_a_Story__Walnut_Creeks_Breakthrough_its_Awesome
There are even more resources related to PBB and hopefully some other members will be able to chime in and point you to other documents which they feel could be useful. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org
